page.title: 13QUEEN'S THEATRE
page.content: The reason we got a new Queen's Theatre was that the old one was small and drab. The new theatre is in Billet Lane. It is only 5 minutes bus ride from Hornchurch station and there are plenty of car parks around. There are 504 seats with 4 more for people in wheelchairs. The seats are built in a continental style with no centre gangway. The back of the stage is so deep that they can hold rehearsals behind the scenery. At the front of the stage is a small orchestra pit. Six dressing rooms have been provided for 28 players. Work started on the site during January 1973 and it was opened to the public on the 2nd April 1975. It was opened by Peter Hall, director of the National Theatre.
